title: The general form
text: The general form of an exponential function is $$y=a b^x$$, where a is the initial value or y-intercept, and $$b$$ is the base of the exponential function.
speech: The general form of an exponential function is  y is equal to, a b to the x-th, , where a is the initial value or y-intercept, and  b  is the base of the exponential function.

, where a is the initial value or y-intercept, and   b
is the base of the exponential function.

title: Use the Given Point
text: Plug in the given point $$(-3,\frac{1}{125})$$ into the general form. This gives you the equation $$\frac{1}{125}=a b^{\left(-3\right)}$$
speech: Plug in the given point  times, parentheses, negative 3 comma 1 over 125   into the general form. This gives you the equation  1 over 125 is equal to a, b raised to the parentheses negative 3  power
